channel.title: Windows 7
channel.description: Hello everyone, I recently upgraded to Windows 7 and I was wondering if anybody new how to set it up for the Clients and Sources to work, currently it tells me that java is not found as an internal or external command.... so thanks.

item.title: Windows 7
item.dc:creator: @Guardianman5 Guardianman5
item.description:
@Guardianman5 wrote:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:5, topic:328371”]Go into your environmental variables and make two new user variables.

Right click My Computer, click properties, click advanced system settings, click advanced(if needed), click environmental variables.

Name:CLASSPATH
Value:CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_VERSION\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

And

Name:PATH
Value:C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_VERSION\bin;

If JDK is installed in Program Files (x86) Than change that, and also change VERSION to your Jdk update version, most likely 17 or 18.[/quote]

if it is installed in Program Files 9x86) where do I put it at instead?

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 7
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Go into your environmental variables and make two new user variables.

Right click My Computer, click properties, click advanced system settings, click advanced(if needed), click environmental variables.

Name:CLASSPATH
Value:CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_VERSION\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

And

Name:PATH
Value:C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_VERSION\bin;

If JDK is installed in Program Files (x86) Than change that, and also change VERSION to your Jdk update version, most likely 17 or 18.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 7
item.dc:creator: @Guardianman5 Guardianman5
item.description:
@Guardianman5 wrote:

Mitko:

Just do what you did with WinXP (set variables), worked for me.

think you could copy and paste your variables for me here? if so it would be much appreciated thanks =)

Davidi2:

Do you have Java installed on windows 7?

I downloaded the jdk and jre 6U16 if thats whatcha mean?

Read full topic
